definition[0]: a judgment made by a bank or other company about how likely a person or business is to pay their debts
definition[1]: a calculation of a company’s or government’s financial strength and the risk of it not being able to repay loans or pay suppliers when it should
example[0]: Chrysler’s credit rating dropped to junk-bond levels when the company was virtually bankrupt.
example[1]: Some analysts believe that Mexico’s credit rating will be upgraded (=increased) to investment grade in the near future.
example[2]: Standard & Poor is downgrading (=decreasing) the credit rating for Sun Alliance Group to double-A-plus from triple-A.
